extension.name: AgentActions
extension.dc:description: Extension to Occurrence Core to capture agents and optionally the specific roles they played in the context of executing actions on occurrences.

property.name: type
property.dc:description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: identifierType
property.dc:description: The type of identifier. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: identifier
property.dc:description: Recommended practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to an identification system. Examples include International Standard Book Number (ISBN), Digital Object Identifier (DOI), and Uniform Resource Name (URN). Persistent identifiers should be provided as HTTP URIs.

property.name: name
property.dc:description: The name of the item. In this case the full name as woud be written on a legal document (without abbreviation), eg givenName familyName

property.name: givenName
property.dc:description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

property.name: familyName
property.dc:description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

property.name: alternateName
property.dc:description: An alias for the item. Other full name agent may have been known under such as maiden name.

property.name: verbatimName
property.dc:description: As written on occurrence, such as the collection or determination label.

property.name: action
property.dc:description: The name of the single action. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: role
property.dc:description: The name of the role the agent played in the context of executing the action. Not to be confused with the agent's role in an organization. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary

property.name: displayOrder
property.dc:description: The display order for the agent that executed the action when more than one agent was a participant.

property.name: startDate
property.dc:description: Start date/time for when action taken on occurrence was initiated.

property.name: endDate
property.dc:description: End date/time for when action taken on occurrence was completed.
